thread.title: Tom Brady says his Super Bowl game winning jersey was stolen | NFL | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Tom Brady says his Super Bowl game winning jersey was stolen | NFL | Sporting News

author: Sara Jane Harris
title: Tom Brady says his Super Bowl game winning jersey was stolen | NFL | Sporting News
text:
February 6, 2017 7:28am EST February 6, 2017 7:28am EST Patriots quarterback Tom Brady had one thing on his mind after leading New England to a record-breaking win over the Falcons in Super Bowl LI: His jersey. Tom Brady (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:28 a.m. ET 
Updated at 7:28 a.m. ET 
Patriots quarterback Tom Brady had one thing on his mind after leading New England to a record-breaking win over the Falcons in Super Bowl LI: His jersey. 
Brady told Patriots owner Robert Kraft that he couldn't find it after the 34-28 overtime victory. 
"Someone stole my game jersey," Brady said to Kraft. 
"You better look online," Kraft responded. 
NFL's Dan Hanzus captured the locker room conversation on video. 
The NFL shared the moment on Twitter, along with the caption: "Hey can someone give Tom Brady his jersey back? #SB51." Hey can someone give Tom Brady his jersey back? #SB51 (via @danhanzus ) pic.twitter.com/cv99qUW4XY 
MORE: Tom Brady named Super Bowl MVP for record fourth time 
The jersey was not stolen, according to a report by NESN . 
NESN, citing information from Tom Leyden of Boston's FOX25, says a “Patriots equipment manager locked up Tom Brady’s Super Bowl-worn jersey. It wasn’t stolen." Watch This
